channel.title: The Grid for a marketing site?
channel.description:
Is anyone here considering using https://thegrid.io/ for your marketing site? It's overselling the "Created by Artificial Intelligence" aspect for sure, but the application of machine learning for conversion optimization is REALLY compelling, and the "works on all devices" aspect is nice too. SEO seems like the biggest wildcard.
I'm thinking of throwing $100 at it, just to take it for a spin next year. Anyone else considering it?

item.title: The Grid for a marketing site?
item.dc:creator: Oliver
item.description:
I’m really wary of systems that promise so much and try to do so much automatically. So much emphasis on AI… to me it sounds like the kind of thing that might get it “right” a number of times but bomb other times, leaving you to figure out how to fix what the AI is trying to do.

But I’m a skeptic.

item.title: The Grid for a marketing site?
item.dc:creator: coreysnipes
item.description:
@jadb - thanks, I’ll do that if I decide to sign up. @jabeuy - Interesting article. I’m glad to hear their creative team is driving the process, so everybody doesn’t end up with sites that look like http://www.arngren.net and http://staceyjjenkins.files.wordpress.com/2011/08/bad-website.jpg

Landing page services like http://unbounce.com and https://www.instapage.com seem like good options for running your own optimizations - at $50-100/mo they’d likely pay for themselves.

EDIT: And here’s a writeup from two years ago, with a nice overview and considerations (like “you need to have sufficient traffic volume for this stuff to work”): http://smallbiztrends.com/2012/11/landing-page-optimization-tools.html
